title: Salute! Kerala Lady Cop Chops Off Her Hair & Donates It For Wigs For Cancer Patients
text:
In a heartwarming gesture, senior civil police officer of Irinjalakuda in Thrissur district Aparna Lavakumar, decided to donate her gorgeous locks to cancer patients going through chemo.

The 46-year-old police officer decided to donate her locks after she met a class-5 student who was battling cancer. She shaved her head and donated it to an NGO that makes wigs for cancer patients.

Source

Speaking to Manorama, a modest Aparna said, "My act doesn't deserve praise as compared to those who donate organs to save lives.'

“My latest act did not deserve any notice at all. My hair will grow back in a year or two. For me real heroes are people who donate their organs for the needy. What is in a look? Your words and deeds are important than your external look,” Hindustan Times quoted her as saying.

For Aparna this gesture wasn't a big deal, in the past too she's gone out of her way to help those in dire need. Reports state that she donated her three gold bangles to a family which was struggling to settle a hospital bill of Rs 60,000 to get the body of their kin released.

Aparna has also had a rough ride, after losing her husband, she had to raise two daughters on her own. The HT report states that her first is a post-graduate and the other is a class 10 student.
